get.summary:
Allows the system operator to list all currently active administrative bounces that have been
configured.

200.description: Returned information about current admin bounces

post.summary:
Allows the system operator to administratively bounce messages that match
certain criteria, or if no criteria are provided, ALL messages.

delete.summary: Allows the system operator to delete an administrative bounce entry by its id.

404.description: The requested bounce id is no longer, or never was, valid

post.summary:
Allows the system operator to trigger a configuration epoch bump,
which causes various configs that are using the Epoch strategy to
be re-evaluated by triggering the appropriate callbacks.

get.summary: Retrieve information about a message given its spool id.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
The spool identifier for the message whose information
is being requested

parameters.name: want_body
parameters.description:
If true, return the message body in addition to the
metadata

get.summary: Retrieve information about messages in a scheduled queue.

parameters.name: queue_name
parameters.description: The name of the scheduled queue

parameters.name: want_body
parameters.description:
If true, return the message body in addition to the
metadata

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Return up to `limit` messages in the queue sample.
Depending on the strategy configured for the queue,
messages may not be directly reachable via this endpoint.
If no limit is provided, all messages in the queue will
be sampled.

get.summary:
Retrieve information about the states that apply to a set of
ready queues, or all queues if no specific queues were named
in the request.

parameters.name: queues
parameters.description: Which queues to request. If empty, request all queue states.

post.summary:
Allows the system operator to administratively rebind messages.
Rebinding can target queues that match
certain criteria, or if no criteria are provided, ALL queues.
Rebinding is moving a message from one scheduled queue into another.
Queue selection is based upon the envelope recipient and message
metadata as described in <https://docs.kumomta.com/reference/queues/>

Changes the diagnostic log filter dynamically.
See <https://docs.kumomta.com/reference/kumo/set_diagnostic_log_filter/>
for more information on diagnostic log filters.
Define a suspension for a ready queue

404.description: Suspension either expired or was never valid

post.summary: Define a suspension for a scheduled queue

404.description: Suspension either expired or was never valid

post.summary:
Allows the system operator to stop a message transfer that was
previously initiated via the `/api/admin/xfer/v1` API endpoint.
The cancellation works by walking the xfer scheduled queue,
reversing the metadata changes made as part of setting up the
xfer (to restore the original scheduling information) and then
re-inserting the message into an appropriate scheduled queue.
post.description:
The cancellation is "instantaneous" in the sense that it applies
just once to the specified xfer scheduled queue.  Any other messages
that are in-flight or imminently about to be reinserted into
that scheduled queue will not be considered, so you may need
to trigger the cancellation a few times over short time span
to ensure that all messages are taken out of the xfer queue.

Cancellation requests always complete asynchronously because
they may operate on very large quantities of messages, and it
is infeasible to wait for completion in the context of
a single HTTP request.

post.summary:
Allows the system operator to transfer messages from the current
node to some other target node.
The transfer (xfer) can target queues that match
certain criteria, or if no criteria are provided, ALL queues.
Queue selection is based upon the envelope recipient and message
metadata as described in <https://docs.kumomta.com/reference/queues/>.
Messages in the selected queues will be moved into an xfer queue
whose name is based on the target specified by the transfer request.

get.summary:
Useful for load balancers to determine when service is available
and ready to receive messages

post.summary:
Inject a message using a given message body, with template expansion,
to a list of recipients.

Performs a message transfer.
This is considered to be an internal API and should not be
targeted by external consumers.

base64.description: If true, the `data` field must be encoded as base64

content_id.description:
Set the `Content-ID` header for this attachment.
This is used in multipart/related messages to
embed inline images in text/html parts.

content_type.description:
The MIME `Content-Type` header that should be
set for this attachment.

data.description:
The content of the payload.
This is interpreted as UTF-8 text unless the
`base64` field is set to `true`.

file_name.description: The the preferred filename for the attachment

bounced.description:
A map of queue name to number of bounced messages that
were processed by this entry since it was created.

campaign.description: The campaign field of the original request, if any.

domain.description: The domain field of the original request, if any.

duration.description:
The time remaining until this entry expires and is automatically
removed.

id.description:
The id of this bounce rule. Corresponds to the `id` field
returned by the originating request that set up the bounce,
and can be used to identify this particular entry if you
wish to delete it later.

reason.description: The reason field of the original request

routing_domain.description: The routing_domain field of the original request, if any.

tenant.description: The tenant field of the original request, if any.

total_bounced.description:
The sum of the number of bounced messages reported by
the `bounced` field.

BounceV1Request.description:
Describes which messages should be bounced.
The criteria apply to the scheduled queue associated
with a given message.

campaign.description: The campaign name to match. If omitted, any campaign will match.

domain.description: The domain name to match. If omitted, any domain will match.

duration.description:
Defaults to "5m". Specifies how long this bounce directive remains active.
While active, newly injected messages that match the bounce criteria
will also be bounced.

expires.description:
instead of specifying the duration, you can set an explicit
expiration timestamp

queue_names.description:
If present, queue_names takes precedence over `campaign`,
`tenant`, and `domain` and specifies the exact set of
scheduled queue names to which the bounce applies.

reason.description:
Reason to log in the delivery log. Each matching message will be bounced
with an AdminBounce record unless you suppress logging.
The reason will also be shown in the list of currently active admin
bounces.

routing_domain.description: The routing_domain name to match. If omitted, any routing_domain will match.

suppress_logging.description:
If true, do not generate AdminBounce delivery logs for matching
messages.

tenant.description: The tenant to match. If omitted, any tenant will match.

bounced.description:
Deprecated: this field is no longer populated, as bounces
are now always asynchronous. In earlier versions the following
applies:

A map of queue name to number of bounced messages that
were processed as part of the initial sweep.
Additional bounces may be generated if/when other messages
that match the rule are discovered, but those obviously
cannot be reported in the context of the initial request.

id.description:
The id of the bounce rule that was registered.
This can be used later to delete the rule if desired.

total_bounced.description:
Deprecated: this field is no longer populated, as bounces are
now always asynchronous. In earlier versions the following applies:

The sum of the number of bounced messages reported by
the `bounced` field.

oneOf.example:
From: user@example.com
Subject: Hello

Hello there

oneOf.description: Describe the MIME structure to be created

amp_html_body.description: If set, will be used to create a text/x-amp-html part

headers.description:
Optional map of headers to include in the message.
This is a map of header name to header value

html_body.description: If set, will be used to create a text/html part

text_body.description: If set, will be used to create a text/plain part

Content.description:
The message content.
Can either be a fully formed MIME message, or a json
object describing the MIME structure that should be created.

email.description: The email address of the sender

name.description: The displayable name of the sender

deferred_generation.description:
When set to true, the injection request will be queued
and the actual generation and substitution will happen
asynchronously with respect to the injection request.

deferred_spool.description:
When set to true, the message will not be written to
the spool until it encounters its first transient failure.
This can improve injection rate but introduces the risk
of loss of accountability for the message if the system
were to crash before the message is delivered or written
to spool, so use with caution!

envelope_sender.description:
Specify the envelope sender that will be sent in the
MAIL FROM portion of SMTP.

substitutions.description:
When using templating, this is the map of placeholder
name to replacement value that should be used by
the templating engine.  This map applies to all
recipients, with the per-recipient substitutions
taking precedence.

oneOf.description: Specify the template dialect to be used

trace_headers.description: Controls which trace headers will be added to the message.

fail_count.description: The number of messages that failed to inject

success_count.description: The number of messages that were injected successfully

id.description: The spool identifier of the message

limit.description:
Return up to `limit` messages in the queue sample.
Depending on the strategy configured for the queue,
messages may not be directly reachable via this endpoint.
If no limit is provided, all messages in the queue will
be sampled.

queue_name.description: The name of the scheduled queue

want_body.description:
If true, return the message body in addition to the
metadata

data.description:
If `want_body` was set in the original request,
holds the message body
data.example:
From: user@example.com
Subject: Hello

Hello there

recipient.description:
The envelope-to address.
May be either an individual string or an array of strings
for multi-recipient messages.

queues.description: Which queues to request. If empty, request all queue states.

RebindV1Request.description:
Describes which messages should be rebound.
The criteria apply to the scheduled queue associated
with a given message.

always_flush.description:
If true, make all matched messages immediately eligible for
delivery.  When false, (the default), only messages whose
queue has changed will be made immediately eligible.

campaign.description: The campaign name to match. If omitted, any campaign will match.

data.description:
The data, a json object with string keys AND values to pass to the
rebind operation

domain.description: The domain name to match. If omitted, any domain will match.

reason.description:
Reason to log in the delivery log. Each matching message will log
with an AdminRebind record unless you suppress logging.

routing_domain.description: The routing_domain name to match. If omitted, any routing_domain will match.

suppress_logging.description:
If true, do not generate AdminRebind delivery logs for matching
messages.

tenant.description: The tenant to match. If omitted, any tenant will match.

trigger_rebind_event.description:
If true, a `rebind` event will be triggered and passed each
message and the supplied data.
If false, no event will be triggered and each field in data
will be applied to the msg metadata, overwriting any previous
value for that key.

email.description: The email address of the recipient

name.description: The displayable name of the recipient

substitutions.description:
When using templating, this is the map of placeholder
name to replacement value that should be used by the
templating engine when processing just this recipient.
Note that `name` is implicitly set from the `name`
field, so you do not need to duplicate it here.

filter.description: The diagnostic filter spec to use

SpoolId.description: Identifies a message within the spool of its host node.

duration.description: how long until this suspension expires and is automatically removed

expires.description: The time at which the suspension will expire

id.description: The id for the suspension. Can be used to cancel the suspension.

name.description: The name of the ready queue that is suspended

reason.example: pause while working on resolving a block with the destination postmaster

duration.description: Specifies how long this suspension remains active.

name.description: The name of the ready queue that should be suspended

reason.example: pause while working on resolving a block with the destination postmaster

id.description: The id of the suspension to cancel

campaign.description: The campaign name to match. If omitted, any campaign will match.

domain.description: The domain name to match. If omitted, any domain will match.

duration.description: Specifies how long this suspension remains active.

id.description:
The id of the suspension. This can be used later to cancel
the suspension.

reason.example: pause while working on resolving a deliverability issue

tenant.description: The tenant name to match. If omitted, any tenant will match.

campaign.description: The campaign name to match. If omitted, any campaign will match.

domain.description: The domain name to match. If omitted, any domain will match.

duration.description: Specifies how long this suspension remains active.

expires.description:
instead of specifying the duration, you can set an explicit
expiration timestamp

queue_names.description:
If present, queue_names takes precedence over `campaign`,
`tenant`, and `domain` and specifies the exact set of
scheduled queue names to which the suspension applies.

reason.example: pause while working on resolving a block with the destination postmaster

tenant.description: The tenant name to match. If omitted, any tenant will match.

id.description:
The id of the suspension. This can be used later to cancel
the suspension.

header_name.description: The name of the supplemental trace header

include_meta_names.description:
List of meta keys that should be included in the
supplemental header

received_header.description: Whether to add a Received: header

supplemental_header.description:
Whether to add a supplemental trace header to encode
additional metadata

queue_name.description: The name of the xfer scheduled queue

reason.description:
Reason to log in the delivery log. Each matching message will log
with an AdminRebind record to indicate that it was moved from
its containing queue, and this reason will be included in that record.

target.description:
Expected to be an HTTP url prefix like:
`https://host.name:8008`
`http://127.0.0.1:8000`

campaign.description: The campaign name to match. If omitted, any campaign will match.

domain.description: The domain name to match. If omitted, any domain will match.

queue_names.description:
If present, queue_names takes precedence over `campaign`,
`tenant`, and `domain` and specifies the exact set of
scheduled queue names to which the xfer applies.

reason.description:
Reason to log in the delivery log. Each matching message will log
with an AdminRebind record to indicate that it was moved from
its containing queue, and this reason will be included in that record.

routing_domain.description: The routing_domain name to match. If omitted, any routing_domain will match.

tenant.description: The tenant to match. If omitted, any tenant will match.

XferV1Request.description:
Describes which messages should be transferred to another
kumomta node.
The criteria apply to the scheduled queue associated
with a given message.

bounced.description:
Deprecated: this field is no longer populated, as bounces
are now always asynchronous. In earlier versions the following
applies:

A map of queue name to number of bounced messages that
were processed as part of the initial sweep.
Additional bounces may be generated if/when other messages
that match the rule are discovered, but those obviously
cannot be reported in the context of the initial request.

id.description:
The id of the bounce rule that was registered.
This can be used later to delete the rule if desired.

total_bounced.description:
Deprecated: this field is no longer populated, as bounces are
now always asynchronous. In earlier versions the following applies:

The sum of the number of bounced messages reported by
the `bounced` field.

fail_count.description: The number of messages that failed to inject

success_count.description: The number of messages that were injected successfully

id.description: The spool identifier of the message
